alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:13PM CDT until April 10 at 4:52AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Sandies Creek Near Westhoff affecting DeWitt County. .Rainfall in the basin has ended, but the creek continues to rise and is expected to crest at Moderate Flood Stage Saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sandies Creek Near Westhoff. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Major lowland flooding from the headwaters southeast of Seguin to the Guadalupe River confluence near Cuero. The flow is over one half mile wide. Livestock are cut off and potentially drowned in low areas of the flood plain. Roads and low bridges near the creek are flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 17.87 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage around midnight to a crest of 23.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday night. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.9 feet on 06/05/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Sandies Creek Westhoff 21.0 17.9 Fri 7 pm CDT 23.5 21.4 16.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 930 AM CDT.
